<BR>
如果维威克是为了我们，谁能与我们抗衡？<BR>
<BR>
命运，可怕而空虚，邪恶的旋转之轮。<BR>
<BR>
我的心有多黑，火辣辣地烤着？<BR>
<BR>
"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_Anticipations
The Anticipations
《预知者》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_Anticipations
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
The Anticipations<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
The Daedra are powerful ancestor spirits, similar in form and substance to the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names), but weaker in power, and more arbitrary and removed from the affairs of mortals. In old times, the Chimer worshiped the Daedra as gods. But they did not deserve this veneration, for the Daedra harm their worshippers as often as help them.<BR>
<BR>
The Advent of the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names) changed this unhappy state. By the Apotheosis, the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names) became the Protectors and High Ancestor Spirits of the Dunmer, and bade the Daedra to give proper veneration and obedience. The Three Good Daedra, Boethiah, Azura, and Mephala, recognized the Divinity of the Triune Ancestors (Blessed Be Their Holy Names). The Rebel Daedra, Molag Bal, Malacath, Sheogorath, and Mehrunes Dagon, refused to swear fealty to the Tribunal (Blessed Be Their Holy Names), and their worshippers were cast out.<BR>
<BR>
These Rebel Daedra thus became the Four Corners of the House of Troubles, and they continue to plague our tranquility and tempt the unwary into Heresy and Dark Worship. The Priests of the Temple remain ever vigilant for signs of the Adversaries' return, sometimes aided by the loyal Three Good Daedra, who are familiar with the wiles of their rebellious kin.<BR>
<BR>
The Good Daedra are known to the Temple as the Anticipations, since they are the early ancestral anticipations of the loving patronage of the Tribunal. The Anticipations are the Daedra Lords Boethiah, Mephala, and Azura.<BR>
<BR>
Boethiah is the Anticipation of Almalexia but male to her female. Boethiah was the ancestor who illuminated the elves ages ago before the Mythic Era. He told them the truth of Lorkhan's test, and defeated Auriel's champion, Trinimac. Boethiah ate Trinimac and voided him. The followers of Boethiah and Trinimac rubbed the soil of Trinimac upon themselves and changed their skins.<BR>
<BR>
Mephala is the Anticipation of Vivec, but manifold and androgynous. Mephala taught the Chimer to evade their enemies or kill them with secret murder. The Chimer were few in those days and threatened on all sides. Mephala taught the Chimer to build Houses. Later, Mephala created the Morag Tong. <BR>
<BR>
Azura is the Anticipation of Sotha Sil, but female to his male. Azura was the ancestor who taught the Chimer how to be different from the Altmer. Her teachings are sometimes attributed to Boethiah. In the stories, Azura is often encountered more as a communal progenitor of the race as a whole rather than as an individual ancestor. She is associated with Dusk and Dawn, and is sometimes called the Mother Soul. Azura's Star, also called the Twilight Star, appears briefly at dawn and dusk low on the horizon below the constellation of the Steed. Azura is associated with mystery and magic, fate and prophecy.<BR>
"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
预知者<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
迪德拉外来神是强大的先祖之灵，外型与本质皆与审判席相似（称颂他们的圣名），但是力量较弱，而且对凡人的事务更专断也更疏离。古时，歧莫将迪德拉君主当成圣神崇拜，然而他们不配获此尊崇，因为迪德拉君主经常伤害其崇拜者，比例跟帮助他们不相上下。<BR>
<BR>
审判席（称颂他们的圣名）的出现改变了这痛苦的情况。经过神格化，审判席（称颂他们的圣名）成为丹莫的保护者和高等祖灵，并命令迪德拉君主展现适度的敬意和服从。三位善良迪德拉君主波耶西亚、阿祖拉和梅法拉，被认可为先祖三位一体，是为神（称颂他们的圣名）。至于反叛的迪德拉君主莫拉格・巴尔、玛拉凯斯、谢尔格拉和梅鲁涅斯・大衮，则拒绝向审判席（称颂他们的圣名）宣示效忠，他们的崇拜者也遭驱逐。<BR>
<BR>
这些反叛的迪德拉君主因而成为动乱之屋的四角，不断打搅我们的安宁并引诱粗心之人堕入异教崇拜。神殿的祭司随时警惕着魔鬼再现，他们有时仰仗忠诚的三位善良的迪德拉君主，毕竟他们更为熟知自己的造反同胞有哪些花招诡计。<BR>
<BR>
神殿称呼三位善良的迪德拉君主为预知者，因为他们是扶持审判席的早期祖先。这三位预知者，即是迪德拉君主波耶西亚、梅法拉和阿祖拉。<BR>
<BR>
波耶西亚是阿玛莱西娅的预知者，不过是男性。早于神话纪元的许久以前，波耶西亚启蒙了精灵。他告诉他们洛克汗试炼的真相，并打败了奥瑞-艾尔的勇士崔尼马克。波耶西亚吃了崔尼马克，再将他放出来。波耶西亚和崔尼马克的追随者将混含崔尼马克的土壤抹在自己身上，改变了肤色。<BR>
<BR>
梅法拉是维威克的预知者，雌雄同体且时时变化。梅法拉教导歧莫如何躲避或暗杀敌人。在那个时代，到处都是敌人，因为歧莫的人数稀少，敌人则四方皆是。梅法拉将氏族组织起来，演变为今日的豪族。之后，梅法拉成立了莫拉格堂。<BR>
<BR>
阿祖拉是索萨希尔的预知者，不过是女性。阿祖拉教导歧莫如何有别于先祖精灵。有时候她的教诲被归于波耶西亚。在故事里，阿祖拉经常是以全种族的祖先之姿而非个体之祖出现。她与晨昏密切相连，有时候被称作神母之灵。阿祖拉之星也叫微明之星，在黄昏和黎明时会短暂低挂在地平线上，位于骏马星座下方。阿祖拉涉及神秘与魔法、命运和预言。<BR>
"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_AncestorsAndTheDunmer
Ancestors and the Dunmer
《先祖与丹莫》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_AncestorsAndTheDunmer
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
Ancestors and the Dunmer<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
Ghosts Walk Among Them<BR>
<BR>
The departed spirits of the Dunmeri, and perhaps those of all races, persist after death. The knowledge and power of departed ancestors benefits the bloodlines of Dunmeri Houses. The bond between the living family members and immortal ancestors is partly blood, partly ritual, partly volitional. A member brought into the House through marriage binds himself through ritual and oath into the clan, and gains communication and benefits from the clan's ancestors; however, his access to the ancestors is less than his offspring, and he retains some access to the ancestors of his own bloodline.<BR>
<BR>
The Family Shrine<BR>
<BR>
Each residence has a family shrine. In poorer homes, it may be no more than a hearth or alcove where family relics are displayed and venerated. In wealthy homes, a room is set aside for the use of the ancestors. This shrine is called the Waiting Door, and represents the door to Oblivion.<BR>
<BR>
Here the family members pay their respects to their ancestors through sacrifice and prayer, through oaths sworn upon duties, and through reports on the affairs of the family. In return, the family may receive information, training, and blessings from the family's ancestors. The ancestors are thus the protectors of the home, and especially the precincts of the Waiting Door.<BR>
<BR>
The Ghost Fence<BR>
<BR>
It is a family's most solemn duty to make sure their ancestor's remains are interred properly in a City of the Dead such as Necrom. Here the spirits draw comfort from one another against the chill of the mortal world. However, as a sign of great honor and sacrifice, an ancestor may grant that part of his remains be retained to serve as part of a ghost fence protecting the clan's shrine and family precincts. Such an arrangement is often part of the family member's will, that a knucklebone shall be saved out of his remains and incorporated with solemn magic and ceremony into a clan ghost fence. In more exceptional cases, an entire skeleton or even a preserved corpse may be bound into a ghost fence.<BR>
<BR>
These remains become a beacon and focus for ancestral spirits, and for the spirit of the remains in particular. The more remains used to make a ghost fence, the more powerful the fence is. And the most powerful mortals in life have the most powerful remains.<BR>
<BR>
The Great Ghost Fence created by the Tribunal to hold back the Blight incorporates the bones of many heroes of the Temple and of the Houses Indoril and Redoran who dedicated their spirits to the Temple and Clan as their surrogate families. The Ghost Fence also contains bones taken from the Catacombs of Necrom and the many battlefields of Morrowind.<BR>
<BR>
The Mortal Chill<BR>
<BR>
Spirits do not like to visit the mortal world, and they do so only out of duty and obligation. Spirits tell us that the otherworld is more pleasant, or at least more comfortable for spirits than our real world, which is cold, bitter, and full of pain and loss.<BR>
<BR>
Mad Spirits<BR>
<BR>
Spirits that are forced to remain in our world against their will may become mad spirits, or ghosts.<BR>
Some spirits are bound to this world because of some terrible circumstances of their death, or because of some powerful emotional bond to a person, place, or thing. These are called hauntings.<BR>
<BR>
Some spirits are captured and bound to enchanted items by wizards. If the binding is involuntary, the spirit usually goes mad. A willing spirit may or may not retain its sanity, depending on the strength of the spirit and the wisdom of the enchanter.<BR>
<BR>
Some spirits are bound against their wills to protect family shrines. This unpleasant fate is reserved for those who have not served the family faithfully in life. Dutiful and honorable ancestral spirits often aid in the capture and binding of wayward spirits.<BR>
<BR>
These spirits usually go mad, and make terrifying guardians. They are ritually prevented from harming mortals of their clans, but that does not necessary discourage them from mischievous or peevish behavior. They are exceedingly dangerous for intruders. At the same time, if an intruder can penetrate the spirit's madness and play upon the spirit's resentment of his own clan, the angry spirits may be manipulated.<BR>
<BR>
Oblivion<BR>
<BR>
The existence of Oblivion is acknowledged by all Tamriel cultures, but there is little agreement on the nature of that otherworld, other than it is the place where the Aedra and Daedra live, and that communication and travel are possible between this world and Oblivion through magic and ritual.<BR>
<BR>
The Dunmer do not emphasize the distinction between this world and Oblivion as do the human cultures of Tamriel. They regard our world and the otherworld as a whole with many paths from one end to the other rather than two separate worlds of different natures with distinct borders. This philosophical viewpoint may account for the greater affinity of Elves for magic and its practices.<BR>
<BR>
Foreign Views of Dunmeri Ancestor Worship and Spirit Magic<BR>
<BR>
The Altmeri and Bosmeri cultures also venerate their ancestors, but only by respecting the orderly and blissful passage of these spirits from this world to the next. That is, Wood Elves and High Elves believe it is cruel and unnatural to encourage the spirits of the dead to linger in our world. Even more grotesque and repugnant is the display of the bodily remains of ancestors in ghost fences and ash pits. The presentation of fingerbones in a family shrine, for example, is sacrilegious to the Bosmer (who eat their dead) and barbaric to the Altmer (who inter their dead).<BR>
<BR>
The human cultures of Tamriel are ignorant and fearful of Dark Elves and their culture, considering them to be inhuman and evil, like Orcs and Argonians, but more sophisticated. The human populations of Tamriel associate Dunmeri ancestor worship and spirit magic with necromancy; in fact, this association of the Dark Elves with necromancy is at least partly responsible for the dark reputation of Dunmer throughout Tamriel. This is generally an ignorant misconception, for necromancy outside the acceptable clan rituals is a most abhorrent abomination in the eyes of the Dunmer.<BR>
<BR>
The Dark Elves would never think of practicing sorcerous necromancy upon any Dark Elf or upon the remains of any Elf. However, Dark Elves consider the human and orcish races to be little more than animals. There is no injunction against necromancy upon such remains, or on the remains of any animal, bird, or insect.<BR>
<BR>
Imperial Policy officially recognizes the practices of Dunmeri ancestor veneration and spirit magic as a religion, and protects their freedom to pursue such practices so long as they do not threaten the security of the Empire. Privately, most Imperial officials and traders believe Dark Elf ancestor worship and displays of remains are barbaric or even necromantic.<BR>
<BR>
Telvanni "Necromancy"<BR>
<BR>
The Telvanni are adept masters of necromancy. They do not, however, practice necromancy upon the remains of Dark Elves. Sane Telvanni regard such practices with loathing and righteous anger. They do practice necromancy upon the remains of animals and upon the remains of Humans, Orcs, and Argonians -- who are technically no more than animals in Morrowind.<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
Publisher's Note: This book was written by an unknown scholar as a guide for foreign visitors to Morrowind shortly after the Armistice was signed. Many of these practices have since fallen into disfavor. The most obvious changes are those regarding the practice of Necromancy and the Great Ghostfence. Dunmer today regard Necromancy upon any of the accepted races as an abomination. The Ghostfence has forced many changes in the practice of ancestor worship. With the vast majority of ancestors' remains going to strengthen the Great Ghostfence around the mountain of Dagoth Ur, there are very few clan ghost fences in Morrowind. The Temple discourages such practices among the Houses as selfish. The upkeep of family tombs and private Waiting Doors has also fallen into disfavor, as very few remains have been buried in these tombs and shrines since the Armistice. In recent years most Dunmer venerate a small portion of their ancestor's remains kept at a local temple.<BR>
<BR>
"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
丹莫的祖先<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
灵魂同在<BR>
<BR>
丹莫的那些逝去的灵魂，甚至包括所有其他种族的，在死亡后都将继续存在。往昔祖先们的知识和力量保证了丹莫家族血统的延续。现存家族成员和永生祖先之间的联系的原因一部分是血统，一部分是习惯，一部分是意志。一个藉由联姻进入该家族的成员通过仪式和誓约使他与这个氏族紧密相连，并且从氏族的祖先那获得消息交流和收益；然而，他与这些祖先们交流的机会却少于他的后代，而且他仍保留一些与他自己血统的祖先们交流的能力。<BR>
<BR>
祖先牌位<BR>
<BR>
每一位居民都有一个祖先牌位。在贫穷的家庭里，可能只有一个壁炉或者牌位来展示和敬仰那些家族遗物。在富有的家庭里，会留出一个房间为供奉祖先而使用。这个牌位被称作守候之门，并且代表着通往湮灭的大门。<BR>
<BR>
在这里家族成员们通过献祭和祷告、对职责的宣誓，和对家族事宜的报告来向他们的祖先表示敬意。作为回报，这个家族能从家族祖先那里获得信息、培养，和祝福。祖先们因此不仅是家的保护者，更是守候之门领域的保护者。<BR>
<BR>
鬼魂之墙<BR>
<BR>
一个家族最神圣的职责就是确保他们祖先的残骸被适当的保存在如尼克姆一样的死亡之城里。在这里这些灵魂相互寻求慰藉来抵抗凡人世界的严寒。然而，作为伟大荣耀和牺牲的标志，一位元祖先能让他的残骸的某一特定部分被保存下来作为保护氏族牌位和家族领域的鬼魂之墙的一部分。而将一块指节骨从残骸中保存下来并通过神圣魔法和仪式制成一道氏族的鬼魂之墙这种安排，通常是家族成员的意愿。在更特殊的情况下，整个骸骨或者甚至是一具保存完好的尸体都可以被制成为一道鬼魂之墙。<BR>
<BR>
这些残骸成为了祖先灵魂们，特别是该残骸的灵魂，的信标和焦点。越多的残骸被用于制造鬼魂之墙，围栏就越强大。并且，在生前最强大的人死后则拥有最强大的残骸。<BR>
<BR>
被审判席创造的用于阻挡枯萎的大型鬼魂之墙，结合了神殿和因多瑞尔与瑞多然家族的许多英雄遗骨，这些英雄将他们的灵魂奉献给作为他们的代理家族的神殿和氏族。这道鬼魂之墙还包括从尼克姆陵寝和晨风的许多战场上取来的遗骨。<BR>
<BR>
致命严寒<BR>
<BR>
灵魂们并不喜欢拜访凡人世界，他们这样做仅仅是出于职责和义务。灵魂们告诉我们冥界要更加安逸，至少对于灵魂们来说比我们这严寒、冷酷，充满痛苦和损失的现实世界更加舒适。<BR>
<BR>
发狂的灵魂<BR>
<BR>
违背意愿被迫停留在我们的世界中的灵魂可能会成为发狂的灵魂，或者幽灵。<BR>
有些灵魂被束缚在这个世界是因为一些他们去世时的可怕遭遇，或者是因为一些寄托在一个人、一个地方，或者一件东西上的强烈情感牵绊。这些都被称作阴魂不散。<BR>
<BR>
有些灵魂会被法师捕获并束缚在附魔的装备上。如果这种束缚是非自愿的，这个灵魂通常会发疯。一个自愿的灵魂是否会保持它的理智，取决于该灵魂的力量和附魔者的智慧。<BR>
<BR>
有些灵魂会被违背意愿束缚住来保护祖先牌位。这种可悲的命运被强加于那些在生前没有衷心侍奉家族的人。忠于职守并受尊敬的先祖灵魂们通常会在捕获和束缚任性倔强的灵魂时伸出援手。<BR>
<BR>
这些灵魂通常会发疯，并且成为可怕的护卫者。通过仪式，他们无法伤害他们氏族的凡人，但是这并不能有效的打消他们恶作剧和易怒的天性。他们对于入侵者来说极度危险。但是同时，如果一个入侵者能看透该灵魂狂暴愤怒的原因并且利用它对它自己氏族的憎恨，这些发怒的灵魂也有可能会被操纵。<BR>
<BR>
湮灭<BR>
<BR>
湮灭的存在是被所有的泰姆瑞尔文明所承认的，但是除了它是神族与魔族生存的地方，和有可能通过魔法和仪式在目前世界和湮灭之间进行交流和旅行之外，对于冥界的本质却几乎没有达成一致。<BR>
<BR>
丹莫并不像泰姆瑞尔的人类文化那样强调目前世界与湮灭之间的区别。他们以一个有着许多从一端到另一端通路的整体看待我们的世界和冥界，而不是两个分开的有着不同本质与边界的世界。这种哲学观点可能导致了精灵与魔法和魔法练习之间更紧密的亲和力。<BR>
<BR>
其他种族对丹莫先祖崇拜和灵魂魔法的观点<BR>
<BR>
傲尔特莫和波兹莫文化同样崇敬他们的祖先，但仅仅是通过重视这些灵魂从这个世界到另一个世界的有序幸福的道路的方法。也就是说，木精灵和高精灵相信让死者的灵魂徘徊在我们的世界是残忍的并且不合常理的。而让祖先们的尸体残骸陈列在灵魂围栏和骨灰槽中则要更加的古怪和反感。例如，在祖先牌位中摆放指节骨，对波兹莫来说是该遭天谴的行为（他们吃掉他们的死者），对傲尔特莫族来说是粗野的行为（他们埋葬他们的死者）。<BR>
<BR>
泰姆瑞尔的人类文明对于暗精灵和他们的文化一无所知并且避而不提，认为他们野蛮邪恶，像兽人和阿尔贡人一样，只是更老练一些。泰姆瑞尔的人类居民把丹莫的先祖崇拜和灵魂魔法联想成了亡灵法术；事实上，这种对暗精灵和亡灵法术的联想至少部分是因为泰姆瑞尔丹莫那恶劣的名声。这通常是一个无知的误解，因为在允许使用它的氏族仪式之外所使用的亡灵法术在丹莫眼里是最令人憎恶的邪恶。<BR>
<BR>
暗精灵从来不会考虑在任何暗精灵或者他们的残骸上实行恐怖的亡灵法术。然而，暗精灵认为人类和兽人种族与动物基本相同。在这些残骸，或者任何动物、鸟类，和昆虫的残骸上可没有对亡灵法术的禁令。<BR>
<BR>
帝国政策正式宣布丹莫尊敬祖先和灵魂魔法的行为是一种信仰，并且只要他们不危及帝国的安全就保证他们进行这种实践的自由。而在私下，大部分帝国官员和商人认为暗精灵先祖崇拜和残骸陈列是野蛮甚至邪恶的。<BR>
<BR>
泰瓦尼“亡灵法术”<BR>
<BR>
泰瓦尼是亡灵法术的高阶大师。然而，他们不在暗精灵的残骸上施展亡灵法术。神志正常的泰瓦尼对这种行为持强烈反感并义愤填膺的态度。但他们的确在动物以及人类、兽人，和阿尔贡人的残骸上施法亡灵法术--在晨风他们严格上说和动物差不多。<BR>
<BR>
<BR>
出版商的声明：这本书由一名不知名的学者书写并在停战协定签署后不久用作到晨风的外来参观者的指南。许多的这些行为在这之后开始逐渐消失。最明显的改变是那些重视亡灵法术和大型灵魂围栏的人。今天的丹莫认为对任何公认的种族施放的亡灵法术都是邪恶的。灵魂围栏导致了先祖崇拜中的许多变革。随着绝大多数的祖先残骸将被送去加强红山周围的大型灵魂围栏，晨风里的氏族灵魂围栏所剩无几。神殿不允许这种家族行为并认为这种做法是自私的。随着在停战协议后几乎没有残骸被埋葬在家族墓穴和牌位中，这些墓穴和私人守候之门也同样逐渐没落。最近几年，大多数的丹莫都在一个当地神殿里通过一小部分残骸来瞻仰他们的祖先。<BR>
<BR>
"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_AnnotatedAnuad
The Annotated Anuad
《阿努解义》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_AnnotatedAnuad
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
The Anuad Paraphrased<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
The first ones were brothers:  Anu and Padomay.  They came into the Void, and Time began.<BR>
<BR>
As Anu and Padomay wandered the Void, the interplay of Light and Darkness created Nir.  Both Anu and Padomay were amazed and delighted with her appearance, but she loved Anu, and Padomay retreated from them in bitterness.<BR>
<BR>
Nir became pregnant, but before she gave birth, Padomay returned, professing his love for Nir.  She told him that she loved only Anu, and Padomay beat her in rage.  Anu returned, fought Padomay, and cast him outside Time.  Nir gave birth to Creation, but died from her injuries soon after.  Anu, grieving, hid himself in the sun and slept.<BR>
<BR>
Meanwhile, life sprang up on the twelve worlds of creation and flourished.  After many ages, Padomay was able to return to Time.  He saw Creation and hated it.  He swung his sword, shattering the twelve worlds in their alignment.  Anu awoke, and fought Padomay again.  The long and furious battle ended with Anu the victor.  He cast aside the body of his brother, who he believed was dead, and attempted to save Creation by forming the remnants of the 12 worlds into one -- Nirn, the world of Tamriel.  As he was doing so, Padomay struck him through the chest with one last blow.  Anu grappled with his brother and pulled them both outside of Time forever.<BR>
<BR>
The blood of Padomay became the Daedra.  The blood of Anu became the stars.  The mingled blood of both became the Aedra (hence their capacity for good and evil, and their greater affinity for earthly affairs than the Daedra, who have no connection to Creation).<BR>
<BR>
On the world of Nirn, all was chaos.  The only survivors of the twelve worlds of Creation were the Ehlnofey and the Hist.  The Ehlnofey are the ancestors of Mer and Men.  The Hist are the trees of Argonia.  Nirn originally was all land, with interspersed seas, but no oceans.<BR>
<BR>
A large fragment of the Ehlnofey world landed on Nirn relatively intact, and the Ehlnofey living there were the ancestors of the Mer.  These Ehlnofey fortified their borders from the chaos outside, hid their pocket of calm, and attempted to live on as before.  Other Ehlnofey arrived on Nirn scattered amid the confused jumble of the shattered worlds, wandering and finding each other over the years.  Eventually, the wandering Ehlnofey found the hidden land of Old Ehlnofey, and were amazed and joyful to find their kin living amid the splendor of ages past.  The wandering Ehlnofey expected to be welcomed into the peaceful realm, but the Old Ehlnofey looked on them as degenerates, fallen from their former glory.  For whatever reason, war broke out, and raged across the whole of Nirn.  The Old Ehlnofey retained their ancient power and knowledge, but the Wanderers were more numerous, and toughened by their long struggle to survive on Nirn.  This war reshaped the face of Nirn, sinking much of the land beneath new oceans, and leaving the lands as we know them (Tamriel, Akavir, Atmora, and Yokuda).  The Old Ehlnofey realm, although ruined, became Tamriel.  The remnants of the Wanderers were left divided on the other 3 continents.<BR>
<BR>
Over many years, the Ehlnofey of Tamriel became the Mer (Elves):<BR>
The Dwemer (the Deep Ones, sometimes called Dwarves)<BR>
The Chimer (the Changed Ones, who later became the Dunmer)<BR>
The Dunmer (the Dark or Cursed Ones, the Dark Elves)<BR>
The Bosmer (the Green or Forest Ones, the Wood Elves)<BR>
The Altmer (The Elder or High Ones, the High Elves).<BR>
<BR>
On the other continents, the Wandering Ehlnofey became the Men: the Nords of Atmora, the Redguards of Yokuda, and the Tsaesci of Akavir.<BR>
<BR>
The Hist were bystanders in the Ehlnofey war, but most of their realm was destroyed as the war passed over it.  A small corner of it survived to become Black Marsh in Tamriel, but most of their realm was sunk beneath the sea.<BR>
<BR>
Eventually, Men returned to Tamriel.  The Nords were the first, colonizing the northern coast of Tamriel before recorded history, led by the legendary Ysgramor.  The thirteenth of his line, King Harald, was the first to appear in written history.  And so the Mythic Era ended.<BR>
<BR>"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
阿努解义<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
在原初之处的是一对兄弟：阿努和帕杜梅。他们来到了虚空之中，于是时间之轮开始转动。<BR>
<BR>
当阿努与帕杜梅在虚空之中徘徊之时，光与暗的碰撞之中诞生了尼尔。阿努和帕杜梅都对她的出现感到惊喜，但是她却只爱着阿努。在苦涩之中，帕杜梅从他们的身边退了出去。<BR>
<BR>
尼尔怀孕了，但就在她分娩之前，帕杜梅回来了。帕杜梅表达了他对尼尔的爱，但尼尔告诉帕杜梅，她只爱阿努，帕杜梅一怒之下打了她。阿努回来了，在愤怒之下与帕杜梅展开了战斗，并将其扔出了时间之外。尼尔生下了创造之物，但却因为受到的伤而死去了。阿努悲痛欲绝，他躲入光明之中渐渐睡去。<BR>
<BR>
这时候，在十二个创造之物的世界中，生命逐渐诞生，并蓬勃发展着。在不知过了多少岁月之后，帕杜梅重返时间之中。他看到了创造之物，他也厌恶着阿努与尼尔所创造的世界。他挥剑，将十二个世界尽数粉碎。阿努再次醒来，并又一次与帕杜梅展开了战斗。这场漫长而激烈的战斗，最终以阿努的胜利告终。他抛弃了他认为已经死去的兄弟的遗体，试图将十二个残破的世界合为一体，创造出一个新的世界--奈恩。就在阿努尝试重塑创造之物时，帕杜梅从他身后一击击穿了他的胸膛。两个兄弟互相搏斗，最终阿努将自己与帕杜梅都永远拉到了时间之外。<BR>
<BR>
帕杜梅的血之中诞生了迪德拉，阿努的血之中诞生了繁星，而帕杜梅与阿努的血所混合之物中诞生了伊德拉（因此他们同时拥有善与恶的能力，他们对于凡间的影响力也强于与创造之物无关的迪德拉）。<BR>
<BR>
奈恩的世界一片混乱，创造之物的十二个世界中唯二的幸存者便是伊尔诺菲和希斯特。伊尔诺菲是人与莫的祖先，而希斯特则成为了阿尔贡尼亚人的神树。奈恩本来是陆地之间穿插着小片的海域，并没有大片的海洋。<BR>
<BR>
伊尔诺菲世界的一大片碎片相对完整地落在奈恩上，而居住在那里的伊尔诺菲正是莫的祖先。这些伊尔诺菲抵御住了来自外界的混乱，巩固了他们世界的边界，将他们自己隐藏在平静之中，并试图像以前一样继续生活。而其他的伊尔诺菲抵达了奈恩，分散在这个破碎的世界的一片混乱之中，多年来一直在世界各处徘徊，寻找同伴。最终，流浪的伊尔诺菲找到了旧时伊尔诺菲的隐秘之地，他们惊喜地发现他们的亲人还生活在过去的辉煌之中。流浪的伊尔诺菲希望能够进入和平的国度共同生活，但是旧时的伊尔诺菲认为这些流浪者是堕落者，他们从昔日的荣耀当中堕落了。不知为何，战争爆发了，战火席卷了整个奈恩。旧时的伊尔诺菲保留了他们古老的力量与知识，但是流浪者的数量更多，而且在奈恩各处长期的生存与斗争使他们变得更加地坚强。这场战争重塑了奈恩的面貌，大多数的土地沉入了海底，只留下了我们如今所知的土地--泰姆瑞尔、阿卡维尔、阿特莫拉和尤库达。旧时的伊尔诺菲王国虽然破败不堪，但却变成了如今的泰姆瑞尔大陆。残余的流浪伊尔诺菲则被分散在其他三块大陆。<BR>
<BR>
许多年以后，泰姆瑞尔的伊尔诺菲逐渐变成了莫：<BR>
锻莫（深精灵，有时也被称为矮人）<BR>
歧莫（变精灵，之后变成了丹莫）<BR>
丹莫（受到诅咒皮肤变灰的暗精灵）<BR>
波斯莫（住在森林里的木精灵）<BR>
傲特莫（古老的高精灵）<BR>
<BR>
在其他大陆流浪的伊尔诺菲变成了人：阿特莫拉大陆的诺德人、尤库达大陆的红卫人以及阿卡维尔大陆的赛埃锡人。<BR>
<BR>
希斯特是伊尔诺菲战争的旁观者，但随着战争结束，他们大多数领土都被占领了。一小部分的希斯特幸存了下来，成为了泰姆瑞尔的黑沼泽，但他们的大部分领地都沉没到了海底。<BR>
<BR>
最终，人回到了泰姆瑞尔，在有文字记载的历史之前，诺德人是第一种在泰姆瑞尔北部海岸殖民的人，由传奇的伊斯格拉莫所领导。他的第十三个家族，哈拉尔德国王，是第一个出现在文字记载的历史上的人。至此，神话纪元结束了。<BR>
<BR>"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_ChildrensAnuad
The Annotated Anuad
《阿努解义》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_ChildrensAnuad
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
The Anuad Paraphrased<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
The first ones were brothers:  Anu and Padomay.  They came into the Void, and Time began.<BR>
<BR>
As Anu and Padomay wandered the Void, the interplay of Light and Darkness created Nir.  Both Anu and Padomay were amazed and delighted with her appearance, but she loved Anu, and Padomay retreated from them in bitterness.<BR>
<BR>
Nir became pregnant, but before she gave birth, Padomay returned, professing his love for Nir.  She told him that she loved only Anu, and Padomay beat her in rage.  Anu returned, fought Padomay, and cast him outside Time.  Nir gave birth to Creation, but died from her injuries soon after.  Anu, grieving, hid himself in the sun and slept.<BR>
<BR>
Meanwhile, life sprang up on the twelve worlds of creation and flourished.  After many ages, Padomay was able to return to Time.  He saw Creation and hated it.  He swung his sword, shattering the twelve worlds in their alignment.  Anu awoke, and fought Padomay again.  The long and furious battle ended with Anu the victor.  He cast aside the body of his brother, who he believed was dead, and attempted to save Creation by forming the remnants of the 12 worlds into one -- Nirn, the world of Tamriel.  As he was doing so, Padomay struck him through the chest with one last blow.  Anu grappled with his brother and pulled them both outside of Time forever.<BR>
<BR>
The blood of Padomay became the Daedra.  The blood of Anu became the stars.  The mingled blood of both became the Aedra (hence their capacity for good and evil, and their greater affinity for earthly affairs than the Daedra, who have no connection to Creation).<BR>
<BR>
On the world of Nirn, all was chaos.  The only survivors of the twelve worlds of Creation were the Ehlnofey and the Hist.  The Ehlnofey are the ancestors of Mer and Men.  The Hist are the trees of Argonia.  Nirn originally was all land, with interspersed seas, but no oceans.<BR>
<BR>
A large fragment of the Ehlnofey world landed on Nirn relatively intact, and the Ehlnofey living there were the ancestors of the Mer.  These Ehlnofey fortified their borders from the chaos outside, hid their pocket of calm, and attempted to live on as before.  Other Ehlnofey arrived on Nirn scattered amid the confused jumble of the shattered worlds, wandering and finding each other over the years.  Eventually, the wandering Ehlnofey found the hidden land of Old Ehlnofey, and were amazed and joyful to find their kin living amid the splendor of ages past.  The wandering Ehlnofey expected to be welcomed into the peaceful realm, but the Old Ehlnofey looked on them as degenerates, fallen from their former glory.  For whatever reason, war broke out, and raged across the whole of Nirn.  The Old Ehlnofey retained their ancient power and knowledge, but the Wanderers were more numerous, and toughened by their long struggle to survive on Nirn.  This war reshaped the face of Nirn, sinking much of the land beneath new oceans, and leaving the lands as we know them (Tamriel, Akavir, Atmora, and Yokuda).  The Old Ehlnofey realm, although ruined, became Tamriel.  The remnants of the Wanderers were left divided on the other 3 continents.<BR>
<BR>
Over many years, the Ehlnofey of Tamriel became the Mer (Elves):<BR>
The Dwemer (the Deep Ones, sometimes called Dwarves)<BR>
The Chimer (the Changed Ones, who later became the Dunmer)<BR>
The Dunmer (the Dark or Cursed Ones, the Dark Elves)<BR>
The Bosmer (the Green or Forest Ones, the Wood Elves)<BR>
The Altmer (The Elder or High Ones, the High Elves).<BR>
<BR>
On the other continents, the Wandering Ehlnofey became the Men: the Nords of Atmora, the Redguards of Yokuda, and the Tsaesci of Akavir.<BR>
<BR>
The Hist were bystanders in the Ehlnofey war, but most of their realm was destroyed as the war passed over it.  A small corner of it survived to become Black Marsh in Tamriel, but most of their realm was sunk beneath the sea.<BR>
<BR>
Eventually, Men returned to Tamriel.  The Nords were the first, colonizing the northern coast of Tamriel before recorded history, led by the legendary Ysgramor.  The thirteenth of his line, King Harald, was the first to appear in written history.  And so the Mythic Era ended.<BR>
<BR>
"""

阿努解义<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
在原初之处的是一对兄弟：阿努和帕杜梅。他们来到了虚空之中，于是时间之轮开始转动。<BR>
<BR>
当阿努与帕杜梅在虚空之中徘徊之时，光与暗的碰撞之中诞生了尼尔。阿努和帕杜梅都对她的出现感到惊喜，但是她却只爱着阿努。在苦涩之中，帕杜梅从他们的身边退了出去。<BR>
<BR>
尼尔怀孕了，但就在她分娩之前，帕杜梅回来了。帕杜梅表达了他对尼尔的爱，但尼尔告诉帕杜梅，她只爱阿努，帕杜梅一怒之下打了她。阿努回来了，在愤怒之下与帕杜梅展开了战斗，并将其扔出了时间之外。尼尔生下了创造之物，但却因为受到的伤而死去了。阿努悲痛欲绝，他躲入光明之中渐渐睡去。<BR>
<BR>
这时候，在十二个创造之物的世界中，生命逐渐诞生，并蓬勃发展着。在不知过了多少岁月之后，帕杜梅重返时间之中。他看到了创造之物，他也厌恶着阿努与尼尔所创造的世界。他挥剑，将十二个世界尽数粉碎。阿努再次醒来，并又一次与帕杜梅展开了战斗。这场漫长而激烈的战斗，最终以阿努的胜利告终。他抛弃了他认为已经死去的兄弟的遗体，试图将十二个残破的世界合为一体，创造出一个新的世界--奈恩。就在阿努尝试重塑创造之物时，帕杜梅从他身后一击击穿了他的胸膛。两个兄弟互相搏斗，最终阿努将自己与帕杜梅都永远拉到了时间之外。<BR>
<BR>
帕杜梅的血之中诞生了迪德拉，阿努的血之中诞生了繁星，而帕杜梅与阿努的血所混合之物中诞生了伊德拉（因此他们同时拥有善与恶的能力，他们对于凡间的影响力也强于与创造之物无关的迪德拉）。<BR>
<BR>
奈恩的世界一片混乱，创造之物的十二个世界中唯二的幸存者便是伊尔诺菲和希斯特。伊尔诺菲是人与莫的祖先，而希斯特则成为了阿尔贡尼亚人的神树。奈恩本来是陆地之间穿插着小片的海域，并没有大片的海洋。<BR>
<BR>
伊尔诺菲世界的一大片碎片相对完整地落在奈恩上，而居住在那里的伊尔诺菲正是莫的祖先。这些伊尔诺菲抵御住了来自外界的混乱，巩固了他们世界的边界，将他们自己隐藏在平静之中，并试图像以前一样继续生活。而其他的伊尔诺菲抵达了奈恩，分散在这个破碎的世界的一片混乱之中，多年来一直在世界各处徘徊，寻找同伴。最终，流浪的伊尔诺菲找到了旧时伊尔诺菲的隐秘之地，他们惊喜地发现他们的亲人还生活在过去的辉煌之中。流浪的伊尔诺菲希望能够进入和平的国度共同生活，但是旧时的伊尔诺菲认为这些流浪者是堕落者，他们从昔日的荣耀当中堕落了。不知为何，战争爆发了，战火席卷了整个奈恩。旧时的伊尔诺菲保留了他们古老的力量与知识，但是流浪者的数量更多，而且在奈恩各处长期的生存与斗争使他们变得更加地坚强。这场战争重塑了奈恩的面貌，大多数的土地沉入了海底，只留下了我们如今所知的土地--泰姆瑞尔、阿卡维尔、阿特莫拉和尤库达。旧时的伊尔诺菲王国虽然破败不堪，但却变成了如今的泰姆瑞尔大陆。残余的流浪伊尔诺菲则被分散在其他三块大陆。<BR>
<BR>
许多年以后，泰姆瑞尔的伊尔诺菲逐渐变成了莫：<BR>
锻莫（深精灵，有时也被称为矮人）<BR>
歧莫（变精灵，之后变成了丹莫）<BR>
丹莫（受到诅咒皮肤变灰的暗精灵）<BR>
波斯莫（住在森林里的木精灵）<BR>
傲特莫（古老的高精灵）<BR>
<BR>
在其他大陆流浪的伊尔诺菲变成了人：阿特莫拉大陆的诺德人、尤库达大陆的红卫人以及阿卡维尔大陆的赛埃锡人。<BR>
<BR>
希斯特是伊尔诺菲战争的旁观者，但随着战争结束，他们大多数领土都被占领了。一小部分的希斯特幸存了下来，成为了泰姆瑞尔的黑沼泽，但他们的大部分领地都沉没到了海底。<BR>
<BR>
最终，人回到了泰姆瑞尔，在有文字记载的历史之前，诺德人是第一种在泰姆瑞尔北部海岸殖民的人，由传奇的伊斯格拉莫所领导。他的第十三个家族，哈拉尔德国王，是第一个出现在文字记载的历史上的人。至此，神话纪元结束了。<BR>

"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_ArcturianHeresy
The Arcturian Heresy
《阿克图斯异说》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_ArcturianHeresy
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
The Arcturian Heresy<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
The Underking, Ysmir Kingmaker<BR>
<BR>
With his god destroyed, Wulfharth finds it hard to keep his form. He staggers out of Red Mountain to the battlefield beyond. The world has shaken and all of Morrowind is made of fire. A strong gale picks up, and blows his ashes back to Skyrim.<BR>
<BR>
Wulfharth adopts and is adopted by the Nords then. Ysmir the Grey Wind, the Storm of Kyne. But through Lorkhan he lost his national identity. All he wants the Nords for is to kill the Tribunal. He raises a storm, sends in his people, and is driven back by Tribunal forces. The Dunmer are too strong now. Wulfharth goes underground to wait and strengthen and reform his body anew. Oddly enough, it is Almalexia who disturbs his rest, summoning the Underking to fight alongside the Tribunal against Ada'Soom Dir-Kamal, the Akaviri demon. Wulfharth disappears after Ada'Soom is defeated, and does not return for three hundred years.<BR>
<BR>
It is the rumbling of the Greybeards that wake him. Though the Empire has crumbled, there are rumors that a chosen one will come to restore it. This new Emperor will defeat the Elves and rule a united Tamriel. Naturally, Wulfharth thinks he is the figure of prophecy. He goes directly to High Hrothgar to hear the Greybeards speak. When they do, Ysmir is blasted to ash again. He is not the chosen one. It is a warrior youth from High Rock. As the Grey Wind goes to find this boy, he hears the Greybeards' warning: remember the color of betrayal, King Wulfharth.<BR>
<BR>
The Western Reach was at war. Cuhlecain, the King of Falkreath in West Cyrodiil, was in a bad situation. To make any bid at unifying the Colovian Estates, he needed to secure his northern border, where the Nords and Reachmen had been fighting for centuries. He allies with Skyrim at the Battle of Old Hrol'dan. Leading his forces was Hjalti Early-Beard. Hjalti was from the island kingdom of Alcaire, in High Rock, and would become Tiber Septim, the First Emperor of Tamriel.<BR>
<BR>
Hjalti was a shrewd tactician, and his small band of Colovian troops and Nord berserkers broke the Reachman line, forcing them back beyond the gates of Old Hrol'dan. A siege seemed impossible, as Hjalti could expect no reinforcements from Falkreath. That night a storm came and visited Hjalti's camp. It spoke with him in his tent. At dawn, Hjalti went up to the gates, and the storm followed just above his head. Arrows could not penetrate the winds around him. He shouted down the walls of Old Hrol'dan, and his men poured in. After their victory, the Nords called Hjalti Talos, or Stormcrown.<BR>
 <BR>
Cuhlecain, with his new invincible general, unifies West Cyrodiil in under a year. No one can stand before Hjalti's storms. The Underking knows that if Hjalti is to become Emperor of Tamriel, he must first capture the Eastern Heartland. Hjalti uses them both. He needs Cuhlecain in the Colovian Estates, where foreigners are mistrusted. It is obvious why he needs Ysmir. They march on the East, the battlemages surrender before their armies, and they take the Citadel. Before Cuhlecain can be crowned, Hjalti secretly murders him and his loyalist contingent. These assassinations are blamed on the enemies of Cuhlecain, which, for political reasons, are still the Western Reach. Zurin Arctus, the Grand Battlemage (not the Underking), then crowns Hjalti as Tiber Septim, new Emperor of All Cyrodiil. After he captures the Imperil Throne, Septim finds the initial administration of a fully united Cyrodiil a time-consuming task. He sends the Underking to deal with Imperial expansion into Skyrim and High Rock. Ysmir, mindful that it might seem as if Tiber Septim is in two places at once, works behind the scenes. This period of levelheaded statesmanship and diplomacy, this sudden silence, heretofore unknown in the roaring tales of Talosian conquest, are explained away later. (The assassination story is embroidered -- now it is popularly Talos' own throat that was cut.)<BR>
<BR>
The human kingdoms are conquered, even Hammerfell, whose capture was figured to be an arduous task. The Underking wants a complete invasion, a chance to battle their foreign wind spirits himself, but Tiber Septim refutes him. He has already made a better plan, one that will seem to legitimize his rule. Cyrodiil supports the losing side of a civil war and are invited in. Finally, the Empire can turn its eyes onto the Elves.<BR>
<BR>
The Underking continues to press on Tiber Septim the need to conquer Morrowind. The Emperor is not sure that it is a wise idea. He has heard of the Tribunal's power. The Underking wants his vengeance, and reminds Tiber Septim that he is fated to conquer the Elves, even the Tribunal. Arctus advises against the move but Septim covets the Ebony in Morrowind, as he sorely needs a source of capital to rebuild Cyrodiil after 400 years of war. The Underking tells him that, with the Tribunal dead, Septim might steal the Tribunal's power and use it against the High Elves (certainly the oldest enemies of Lorkhan, predating even the Tribunal). Summerset Isle is the farthest thing from Tiber Septim's mind. Even then, he was planning to send Zurin Arctus to the King of Alinor to make peace. The Ebony need wins out in the end. The Empire invades Morrowind, and the Tribunal give up. When certain conditions of the Armistice include not only a policy of noninterference with the Tribunal, but also, in the Underking's eyes, a validation of their religious beliefs, Ysmir is furious. He abandons the Empire completely. This was the betrayal the Greybeards spoke of. Or so he thinks.<BR>
<BR>
Without the Underking's power, all ideas of conquering Tamriel vanish. Would've been nice, Septim thinks, but let's just worry about Cyrodiil and the human nations. Already there is a rebellion in Hammerfell. <BR>
<BR>
Pieces of Numidium trickle in, though. Tiber Septim, always fascinated by the Dwarves, has Zurin Arctus research this grand artifact. In doing so, Arctus stumbles upon some of the stories of the war at Red Mountain. He discovers the reason the Numidium was made and some of it's potential. Most importantly, he learns the Underking's place in the War. But Zurin Arctus was working from incomplete plans. He thinks it is the heart of Lorkhan's body that is needed to power the Numidium.<BR>
<BR>
While Zurin Arctus is raving about his discovery, the prophecy finally becomes clear to Tiber Septim. This Numidium is what he needs to conquer the world. It is his destiny to have it. He contacts the Underking and says he was right all along. They should kill the Tribunal, and they need to get together and make a plan. While the Underking was away he realized the true danger of Dagoth-Ur. Something must to be done. But he needs an army, and his old one is available again. The trap is set.<BR>
<BR>
The Underking arrives and is ambushed by Imperial guards. As he takes them on, Zurin Arctus uses a soulgem on him. With his last breath, the Underking's Heart roars a hole through the Battlemage's chest. In the end, everyone is dead, the Underking has reverted back to ash, and Tiber Septim strolls in to take the soulgem. When the Elder Council arrives, he tells them about the second attempt on his life, this time by his trusted battle mage, Zurin Arctus, who was attempting a coup. He has the dead guards celebrated as heroes, even the one who was blasted to ash... He warns Cyrodiil about the dangers within, but says he has a solution to the dangers without. The Mantella.<BR>
 <BR>
The Numidium, while not the god Tiber Septim and the Dwemer hoped for (the Underking was not exactly Lorkhan, after all), it does the job. After its work on Summerset Isle a new threat appears -- a rotting undead wizard who controls the skies. He blows the Numidium apart. But it pounds him into the ground with its last flailings, leaving only a black splotch. The Mantella falls into the sea, seemingly forever.<BR>
<BR>
Meanwhile, Tiber Septim crowns himself the First Emperor of Tamriel. He lives until he is 108, the richest man in history. All aspects of his early reign are rewritten. Still, there are conflicting reports of what really happened, and this is why there is such confusion over such questions as: Why does Alcaire claim to be the birthplace of Talos, while other sources say he came from Atmora? Why does Tiber Septim seem to be a different person after his first roaring conquests? Why does Tiber Septim betray his battlemage? Is the Mantella the heart of the battlemage or is it the heart of Tiber Septim?<BR>
 <BR>
Tiber Septim is succeeded by his grandson, Pelagius I. Pelagius is just not of the same caliber. In truth, he's a little nervous with all these provinces. Then an advisor shows up. <BR>
<BR>
$93I was friends with your grandfather,$94 the Underking says, $93He sent me to help you run the Empire."<BR>
<BR>
"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
阿克图斯异说<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
幽域之主，伊斯米尔拥王者<BR>
<BR>
随着他的神被摧毁，武夫哈斯发现他很难保持自己的状态。他踉踉跄跄地走出红山，来到更远处的战场。天地震动，晨风化作火海。一阵强风刮起，将他的灰烬吹回了天际。<BR>
<BR>
武夫哈斯接受了诺德人，并随后为诺德人所接受。灰风伊斯米尔，吉内之风。但由于洛克汗，他失去了自己的民族身份。他需要诺德人的唯一目的就是杀死审判席。他掀起一场风暴，派出他的人民，却被审判席的力量击退。现在的丹莫太强了。武夫哈斯进入地下等待，并重新强化和改造他的身体。奇怪的是，恰恰是阿玛莱西娅打搅了他的安息，她召唤出幽域之主，与审判席并肩对抗阿达'苏姆・迪尔-卡玛尔，阿卡维尔恶魔。武夫哈斯在阿达'苏姆被击败后消失了，三百年间都没有回来。<BR>
<BR>
唤醒他的是灰胡子的隆隆声。虽然帝国已经崩溃，但有传言称，一位被选中的人将会重建它。这位新皇帝将击败精灵并统治统一的泰姆瑞尔。自然，武夫哈斯认为他就是预言中的人物。他直接前往霍斯加高峰聆听灰胡子的讲话。当他们这样做时，伊斯米尔再次被炸成灰烬。他不是被选中的人。被选中的是一位来自高岩的青年战士。当灰风去寻找这个男孩时，他听到了灰胡子的警告：记住背叛的颜色，武夫哈斯国王。<BR>
<BR>
西瑞驰当时正处于战争状态。西罗帝尔西部的佛克瑞斯之王库勒凯恩处境不利。为了统一科洛维亚邦国，他需要保护他的北部边界，诺德人和瑞驰人已经在那里互相争斗了几个世纪。他在古赫洛登之战中与天际结盟。领导他的部队的是希雅提・早髯。希雅提来自高岩的岛国阿里克尔，后来成为泰姆瑞尔的第一任皇帝泰伯・塞普汀。<BR>
<BR>
希雅提是一位精明的战术家，他带领的一小队科洛维亚军队和诺德狂战士攻破了瑞驰人的防线，迫使他们回到古赫洛登城门外。围攻似乎是不可能的，因为希雅提无法指望来自福克瑞斯的援军。那天晚上，一场风暴袭来，造访了希雅提的营帐。它在他的帐篷里和他说话。黎明时分，哈尔蒂走到大门前，风暴就在他头顶上空盘旋。箭矢无法穿透他周围的风。他吼倒了古赫洛登的城墙，他的部下蜂拥而入。在他们胜利后，诺德人称他为希雅提・塔洛斯，或风暴王冠。<BR>
 <BR>
库勒凯恩和他所向披靡的新将军在不到一年的时间里统一了西罗迪尔西部。没有人能抵挡希雅提的风暴。幽域之主知道，如果希雅提想要成为泰姆瑞尔的皇帝，他必须首先占领东部的心脏地。希雅提同时利用了两者。他需要库莱凯恩留在不信任外国人的科洛维亚邦国，而很明显他为什么需要伊斯米尔。他们向东方进军，战斗法师在他们的军队面前投降，他们占领了堡垒。抢在库勒凯恩加冕之前，希雅提暗中谋杀了他和忠于他的人。这些暗杀被归咎于库勒凯恩的敌人，出于政治原因，这些“敌人”仍是指西瑞驰。大战斗法师（不是幽域之主）祖林・阿克图斯随后将希雅提加冕为泰伯・塞普汀，全西罗帝尔的新皇帝。在夺取了帝国皇位后，塞普汀发现对统一的西罗帝尔进行初期管理是一件耗时的工作。他派幽域之主去处理帝国向天际和高岩的扩张。伊斯米尔注意到这看上去可能像是泰伯・塞普汀同时身处两个地方，因此一直进行幕后工作。这一时期冷静的政治家风度和外交手腕，以及这种突然的沉默，与迄今为止塔洛斯征服传说中无坚不摧的吼声大相径庭，不过这些后来都被解释了。（暗杀的故事被修饰掩盖--现在人们普遍认为塔洛斯自己的喉咙被割开了。）<BR>
<BR>
人类王国被征服了，甚至连落锤也是如此，夺取它被认为是一项艰巨的任务。幽域之主想要一次彻底的入侵，希望有机会亲自与他们的外来风灵战斗，但泰伯・塞普汀驳斥了他。他已经制定了一个更好的计划，一个似乎能够使他的统治合法化的计划。西罗帝尔支持落锤内战的失败方，并被邀请加入了内战。终于，帝国可以将目光转向精灵。<BR>
<BR>
幽域之主继续向泰伯・塞普汀施压，要求他征服晨风。皇帝不确定这是否是一个明智的想法。他听说过审判席的力量。幽域之主想要复仇，并提醒泰伯・塞普汀，他注定要征服精灵乃至审判席。阿克图斯反对这一举动，但塞普汀觊觎晨风的黑檀，因为他迫切需要资金来源以重建经历了四百年战乱的西罗帝尔。幽域之主告诉他，随着审判席的死亡，塞普汀有机会窃取审判席的力量并用它来对抗高精灵（当然是洛克汗最古老的敌人，甚至早于审判席）。夏暮岛是泰伯・塞普汀心中最遥远的东西。即便如此，他依然计划将祖林・阿克图斯送去艾琳诺之王那里以求和平。对黑檀的需求最终胜出。帝国入侵晨风，审判席投降。当停战协议的某些条件不仅包括不干涉审判席的政策，而且在幽域之主眼中还包括对其宗教信仰的认可时，伊斯米尔大怒。他彻底放弃了帝国。这就是灰胡子所说的背叛。或者说他是这么认为的。<BR>
<BR>
没有了幽域之主的力量，所有征服泰姆瑞尔的想法都不复存在了。这样就挺好，塞普汀想，但我们还是担心西罗帝尔和人类国家吧。落锤省已经发生了叛乱。<BR>
<BR>
不过，努米迪安的碎片仍被陆续收集。一直对矮人着迷的泰伯・塞普汀让祖林・阿克图斯研究这件伟大的神器。在研究中，阿克图斯偶然发现了红山战争的一些故事。他发现了制造努米迪安的原因以及它的一些潜力。最重要的是，他了解了幽域之主在那场战争中的地位。但祖林・阿克图斯的计划并不完整。他认为，为努米迪安提供动力所需要的是洛克汗身体的心脏。<BR>
<BR>
当祖林・阿克图斯为他的发现而着迷时，泰伯・塞普汀终于明白了他的预言。这个努米迪安就是他征服世界所需要的。拥有它是他的命运。他联系了幽域之主，并说他一直都是对的。他们应该杀死审判席，他们需要聚在一起制定计划。当幽域之主离开时，他意识到了达格斯-乌尔的真正危险。他知道自己必须做点什么。但他需要一支军队，而如今他的旧部又可以归他所用。陷阱已设。<BR>
<BR>
地底之王回来了，并遭受到了帝国卫兵的伏击。他对付他们时，祖林・阿克图斯对他使用了一颗灵魂石。借着最后一口气，幽域之主的心脏在战斗法师的胸口吼开了一个洞。最后，所有人都死了，幽域之主又化为灰烬，而泰伯・塞普汀则漫步走来，拿走了灵魂石。当上古议会到达时，他向他们讲述了他这一生中的第二次谋杀，这一次是他所信任的战斗法师祖林・阿克图斯试图发动政变。他将死去的卫兵称为英雄，甚至是被炸成灰烬的那位......他警告了西罗帝尔内部的危险，但表示他有办法解决外部的危险。用曼特拉。<BR>
 <BR>
努米迪安虽然不是泰伯・塞普汀和锻莫所希望的神（毕竟，幽域之主并不完全是洛克汗），但它完成了它的任务。它在夏暮岛启动后，一个新的威胁出现了--一位控制天空的腐朽的不死巫师。他炸碎了努米迪安。但它用最后的挥击将他重重地砸在了地上，只留下一个黑色的斑点。曼特拉落入大海，似乎永远消失了。<BR>
<BR>
另一方面，泰伯・塞普汀加冕成为泰姆瑞尔的第一位皇帝。他活到108岁，成为了历史上最富有的人。他早期统治的各个方面都被改写了。尽管如此，对于到底发生了什么，仍然存在着相互矛盾的报道，这就是为什么人们对以下问题如此困惑：为什么阿里克尔据称是塔洛斯的出生地，而其他消息来源却说他来自阿特莫拉？为什么泰伯・塞普汀在第一次轰轰烈烈的征服之后似乎变了一个人？泰伯・塞普汀为何背叛他的战斗法师？曼特拉是战斗法师的心脏还是泰伯・塞普汀的心脏？<BR>
 <BR>
泰伯・塞普汀死后，由他的孙子佩拉吉奥斯一世继任。佩拉吉奥斯的能力与他的祖父不一样。事实上，他对所有这些省份都有点紧张。然后一位顾问出现了。<BR>
<BR>
“我是你祖父的朋友，”幽域之主说，“他派我来帮助你管理帝国。”<BR>
<BR>
"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_ChildrenOfTheSky
Children of the Sky
《天空之子》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_ChildrenOfTheSky
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
Children of the Sky<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
Nords consider themselves to be the children of the sky. They call Skyrim the Throat of the World, because it is where the sky exhaled on the land and formed them. They see themselves as eternal outsiders and invaders, and even when they conquer and rule another people; they feel no kinship with them.<BR>
<BR>
The breath and the voice are the vital essence of a Nord. When they defeat great enemies they take their tongues as trophies. These are woven into ropes and can hold speech like an enchantment. The power of a Nord can be articulated into a shout, like the kiai of an Akaviri swordsman. The strongest of their warriors are called "Tongues." When the Nords attack a city, they take no siege engines or cavalry; the Tongues form in a wedge in front of the gatehouse, and draw in breath. When the leader lets it out in a kiai, the doors are blown in, and the axemen rush into the city. Shouts can be used to sharpen blades or to strike enemies. A common effect is the shout that knocks an enemy back, or the power of command. A strong Nord can instill bravery in men with his battle-cry, or stop a charging warrior with a roar. The greatest of the Nords can call to specific people over hundreds of miles, and can move by casting a shout, appearing where it lands. <BR>
<BR>
The most powerful Nords cannot speak without causing destruction. They must go gagged, and communicate through a sign language and through scribing runes. <BR>
<BR>
The further north you go into Skyrim, the more powerful and elemental the people become, and the less they require dwellings and shelters. Wind is fundamental to Skyrim and the Nords; those that live in the far wastes always carry a wind with them.<BR>
<BR>
"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
天空之子<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
诺德人认为自己是天空之子。他们称天际为世界之喉，只因天空在大地之上进行吐息得以塑造他们。他们认为自己是永恒的异乡人与入侵者，即使他们征服、统治了另一个民族；也未曾对该民族产生亲族之情。<BR>
<BR>
呼吸和声音是诺德人的精髓。当他们击败强大的敌人时，会割下敌人的舌头作为战利品，将其编成绳索，用作缚住言语的魔符。诺德人能够将力量转变为战吼，就像阿卡维尔剑士的“气合”一样。他们之中最强壮的战士被称作“舌头”。诺德人攻城时不会使用投石车或骑兵队，而是由“舌头”在城门前摆出楔形阵型，深深吸一口气。当首领发出战吼时，大门即会被吼声震开，斧手一拥而入。吼声还可以用来磨砺刀刃或指挥战斗。这时，吼声通常可以起到发起指挥和击退敌军的作用。此外，强壮的诺德人能用战吼激励同伴，或者将朝他冲锋的对手喝退。而最强大的诺德人可以用吼声召唤数百英里外的特定对象，甚至利用吼声瞬移，出现在吼声到达的地方。 。<BR>
<BR>
强大的诺德人无法在不造成破坏的情况下说话。他们必须被塞住嘴巴，并通过手语和书写符文进行交流。<BR>
<BR>
你愈发北上深入天际，诺德人便会更为强大与朴素，对住所与庇护的需求愈发稀少。风是诺德人与天际的根基；那些身居遥远荒野的人总是与风为伴。<BR>
<BR>
"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_ChroniclesNchuleft
Chronicles of Nchuleft
《纳曲莱夫特编年史》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_ChroniclesNchuleft
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
Chronicles of Nchuleft<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
[This is a chronicle of events of historical significance to the Dwemer Freehold Colony of Nchuleft. The text was probably recorded by an Altmer, for it is written in Aldmeris.]<BR>
<BR>
23. The Death of Lord Ihlendam<BR>
<BR>
It happened in Second Planting (P.D. 1220) that Lord Ihlendam, on a journey in the Western Uplands, came to Nchuleft; and Protector Anchard and General Rkungthunch met him there, and Dalen-Zanchu also came to the meeting.  They talked together long by themselves; but this only was known of their business, that they were to be friends of each other.  They parted, and each went home to his own colony.  <BR>
<BR>
Bluthanch and her sons came to hear of this meeting, and saw in this secret meeting a treasonable plot against the Councils; and they often talked of this among themselves.  When spring came, the Councils proclaimed, as usual, a Council Meet, in the halls of Bamz-Amschend. The people accordingly assembled, handfasted with ale and song, drinking bravely, and much and many things were talked over at the drink-table, and, among other things, were comparisons between different dwemer, and at last among the Councilors themselves. <BR>
<BR>
One said that Lord Ihlendam excelled his fellow Councilors by far, and in every way. At this Councilor Bluthanch was very angry, and said that she was in no way less than Lord Ihlendam, and that she was eager to prove it. Instantly both parties were so inflamed that they challenged each other to battle, and ran to their arms.  But some citizens who were less drunk, and more understanding, came between them, and quieted them; and each went back to his colony, but nobody expected that they would ever meet in peace again together.  <BR>
<BR>
But then, in the fall, Lord Ihlendam received a message from Councilor Bluthanch, inviting him to a parlay at Hendor-Stardumz. And all Ihlendam's kin and citizens strongly urged him not to come, fearing treachery, but Lord Ihlendam would not listen to counsel, not even to carrying with him his honor guard. And sadly, it came to pass that, while traveling to Hendor-Stardumz, in Chinzinch Pass, a host of foul creatures set upon Lord Ihlendam and killed him, and all of his party. And many citizens said thereafter that Bluthanch and her sons had conjured these beasts and set them upon Lord Ihlendam, but nothing was proven. Lord Ihlendam lies buried at a place called Leftunch.<BR>
<BR>
"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
纳曲莱夫特编年史<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
[这是一部对纳曲莱夫特锻莫保有殖民地具有历史意义的事件编年史。这段文字很可能是傲特莫记录的，因为它是用奥德莫瑞语写的。]<BR>
<BR>
23. 伊伦丹勋爵之死<BR>
<BR>
在第一纪元1220年次种节中，伊伦丹勋爵在西部高地的旅途中来到了纳曲莱夫特。安查德护法和鲁贡通将军在那里会见了他，达连赞楚也来了。他们单独聊了很久；但这是他们之间的事，后人只了解到----他们成了彼此的朋友。随后他们各自分别，回到了各自的殖民地。<BR>
<BR>
布鲁桑琪和她的儿子们听说了这次会议，并在这次秘密会议上看到了一场针对议会的叛国阴谋。他们经常互相谈论这件事。春天来临时，议会像往常一样在巴姆兹-阿姆申德的大厅里宣布召开议会会议。人们因此聚集在一起，把酒言欢，在酒桌上讨论了诸多事务，其中包括不同锻莫之间的比较，最后是议员们自己之间的比较。<BR>
<BR>
有人说伊伦丹勋爵在各方面都远胜于其他同僚。对此，布鲁桑琪议员非常生气，说她丝毫不逊色于伊伦丹勋爵，而且她急于证明这一点。双方顷刻间都被激怒了，他们互相战斗，打得不可开交。但是几位不怎么醉、通情达理的市民，却走到他们中间，让他们安静下来。他们各自都回到了殖民地，但没有人期望他们会再次和平相处。<BR>
<BR>
但随后，在秋天，伊伦丹勋爵收到了来自议员布鲁桑琪的消息，邀请他参加亨多尔-斯达杜姆兹的联谊会。伊伦丹的亲族和子民都极力劝阻他不要参加，生怕对方背信弃义，但伊伦丹勋爵不听劝告，甚至没带他的卫队。可悲的是，在前往钦津奇山口的时，一群邪恶的生物袭击了伊伦丹勋爵并杀死了他和他所有的同伴。许多市民随后表示，布鲁桑琪和她的儿子们召唤了这些野兽，放出它们并让其袭击了伊伦丹勋爵，但未被证实。伊伦丹勋爵被葬在一个叫做莱夫特昂楚的地方。<BR>
<BR>
"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_BookOfDaedra
The Book of Daedra
《迪德拉之书》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_BookOfDaedra
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
The Book of Daedra<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
[These are excerpts from this lengthy tome, describing the nature of each of the Daedra.]<BR>
<BR>
Azura, whose sphere is dusk and dawn, the magic in-between realms of twilight, known as Moonshadow, Mother of the Rose, and Queen of the Night Sky.<BR>
<BR>
Boethiah, whose sphere is deceit and conspiracy, and the secret plots of murder, assassination, treason, and unlawful overthrow of authority.<BR>
<BR>
Clavicus Vile, whose sphere is the granting of power and wishes through ritual invocations and pact.<BR>
<BR>
Hermaeus Mora, whose sphere is scrying of the tides of Fate, of the past and future as read in the stars and heavens, and in whose dominion are the treasures of knowledge and memory. <BR>
<BR>
Hircine, whose sphere is the Hunt, the Sport of Daedra, the Great Game, the Chase, known as the Huntsman and the Father of Manbeasts.<BR>
<BR>
Malacath, whose sphere is the patronage of the spurned and ostracized, the keeper of the Sworn Oath, and the Bloody Curse. <BR>
<BR>
Mehrunes Dagon, whose sphere is Destruction, Change, Revolution, Energy, and Ambition. <BR>
<BR>
Mephala, whose sphere is obscured to mortals; known by the names Webspinner, Spinner, and Spider; whose only consistent theme seems to be interference in the affairs of mortals for her amusement. <BR>
<BR>
Meridia, whose sphere is obscured to mortals; who is associated with the energies of living things. <BR>
<BR>
Molag Bal, whose sphere is the domination and enslavement of mortals; whose desire is to harvest the souls of mortals and to bring mortals souls within his sway by spreading seeds of strife and discord in the mortal realms. <BR>
<BR>
Namira, whose sphere is the ancient Darkness; known as the Spirit Daedra, ruler of sundry dark and shadowy spirits; associated with spiders, insects, slugs, and other repulsive creatures which inspire mortals with an instinctive revulsion. <BR>
<BR>
Nocturnal, whose sphere is the night and darkness; who is known as the Night Mistress. <BR>
<BR>
Peryite, whose sphere is the ordering of the lowest orders of Oblivion, known as the Taskmaster. <BR>
<BR>
Sanguine, whose sphere is hedonistic revelry and debauchery, and passionate indulgences of darker natures.<BR>
<BR>
Sheogorath, whose sphere is Madness, and whose motives are unknowable. <BR>
<BR>
Vaernima, whose sphere is the realm of dreams and nightmares, and from whose realm issues forth evil omens. <BR>
<BR>
[Especially marked for special interest under the heading "Malacath" you find a reference to SCOURGE, blessed by Malacath, and dedicated to the use of mortals. In short, the reference suggests that any Daedra attempting to invoke the weapon's powers will be expelled into the voidstreams of Oblivion.] <BR>
<BR>
"Of the legendary artifacts of the Daedra, many are well known, like Azura's Star, and Sheogorath's Wabbajack. Others are less well known, like Scourge, Mackkan's Hammer, Bane of Daedra...." <BR>
<BR>
"...yet though Malacath blessed Scourge to be potent against his Daedra kin, he thought not that it should fall into Daedric hands, then to serve as a tool for private war among caitiff and forsaken. Thus did Malacath curse the device such that, should any dark kin seek to invoke its powers, that a void should open and swallow that Daedra, and purge him into Oblivion's voidstreams, from thence to pathfind back to the Real and Unreal Worlds in the full order of time." <BR>
"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
迪德拉之书<BR><BR>
<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><BR><BR>
[这些是这本长篇巨著的节选，描述了每一位迪德拉君主的本质。]<BR>
<BR>
阿祖拉，掌管暮色与破晓，是黄昏魔法的象征，被奉为“月影”，“玫瑰之母”以及“夜空女王”。<BR>
<BR>
波耶西亚，掌管欺骗与阴谋，是谋杀与暗杀、叛变与政变的代言人。<BR>
<BR>
卡拉威库斯・维尔，通过祷告与契约，赐予世人力量，实现他们的心愿。<BR>
<BR>
赫麦尤斯・莫拉，天命的预言者，运用占星回首往事，预知未来，是知识与经验宝库的主宰。<BR>
<BR>
海尔辛，掌管狩猎、迪德拉竞技、运动会以及赛跑，被奉为“猎人”与“人兽之祖”。<BR>
<BR>
玛拉凯斯，流放者的保护神，掌管誓言与血腥诅咒。<BR>
<BR>
梅鲁涅斯・大衮，掌管毁灭、变革、能量与野心。<BR>
<BR>
梅法拉，掌管范围不明，人称“丝蚁”、“蜘蛛”。她似乎终日以扰乱世事为乐。<BR>
<BR>
美瑞蒂亚，掌管范围不明。与生命能量有着千丝万缕的联系。<BR>
<BR>
莫拉格・巴尔，掌管主宰与役使凡人。他在世间制造争端与冲突，以实现他收割并统治世人魂灵的野心。<BR>
<BR>
娜米拉，掌管先古的黑暗。被奉为“迪德拉魂灵”、“黑暗主宰”以及“暗影之魂”。与蜘蛛、昆虫、刺蛾等令人反感的生物颇有渊源。<BR>
<BR>
诺克图娜尔，掌管黑夜，被奉为“暗夜女神”。<BR>
<BR>
魄伊特，掌管湮灭的底层秩序，人称“工头”。<BR>
<BR>
桑吉恩，掌管狂欢与纵欲。<BR>
<BR>
谢尔格拉，掌管疯狂，其想法令人捉摸不透。<BR>
<BR>
瓦尔迷纳，掌管梦境与梦魇，不祥之兆皆出于此。<BR>
<BR>
（“玛拉凯斯”条目下的特殊标记表明你找到了一本关于惩罚者的参考书，这是玛拉凯斯赐予凡人的礼物。简而言之，本书告诉我们任何试图运用这一武器力量的迪德拉将被放逐至湮灭的虚无之溪。）<BR>
<BR>
“迪德拉的传奇器物天下闻名，例如阿祖拉之星，以及谢尔格拉之杖。还有一些的名头则没有那么响亮，譬如惩罚者、马克堪之锤、迪德拉灾星......”<BR>
<BR>
“......然而尽管玛拉凯斯希望惩罚者成为对付他迪德拉族人的利器，但他还是认为其不应落入迪德拉之手，成为解决私人恩怨的工具。因此玛拉凯斯诅咒了此物，若心怀不轨的族人试图调动它的力量，它就将打开一道缝隙，吞噬这名迪德拉，将其打入湮灭的虚无之溪，其余生就将在寻求返回现实与虚无世界的道路中度过”<BR>
"""

> BOOK.FNAM bk_bartendersguide
Hanin's Wake
《哈宁的守灵》

> BOOK.TEXT bk_bartendersguide
"""<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
...and upon that year of the Reign of Wulfharth and his Son's, the Magnificence that was Mordrin Hanin ended in this world. Representative of Ashalmawia, Maelkashishi and Ald Sotha gathered in a great host at the vastness of Assurnabitashpi. Even Hilbongard and Dorach Gusal were lured from their Forge, and for a time the Fires of Anudnabia were silent.<BR>
<BR>
And thus on the Ninth Day of Mourning, many slaves and enemies were sacrificed and the Cup of Passage was mixed according to the direction of Hanin's Formulae:<BR>
<BR>
  2 Parts Blood of Traitors<BR>
  1 Part Heart of Daedra<BR>
  1 Part mixed Bittergreen Petals, Void Salts, Green Lichens and Bonemeal<BR>
  1 Part Moonsugar<BR>
  5 Parts Flin<BR>
<BR>
Combine Blood, Heart, Moonsugar in Large Ebony Alembic. Heat fire fed by Bones of Traitors. Condense vapors into a large Ebony flask. For a hot drink, strain contents through Scamp Skin and mix with Flin in large mug, slowly stirring with a glass rod. For a chilled drink, mix in flask with pure Skyrim Ice and shake vigorously. Strain through Winged Twilight membrane and served in gem encrusted goblet.<BR>
<BR>
The wake was considered a great success as the beverage killed a great many guests and thus Mordrin Hanin was supplied with companions in the next world.<BR>
<BR>
"""
"""<DIV ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT COLOR="000000" SIZE="3" FACE="Magic Cards"><BR>
...在武夫哈斯和他的儿子统治的那一年，莫尔德林・哈宁的辉煌结束了。阿沙尔马维亚、梅尔卡诗诗与奥德-索萨的代表们在阿舒纳比塔什的广袤土地上齐聚一堂，甚至希尔邦加德和多拉赫・古萨尔都离开了他们的锻造厂来到地上，阿努德纳比亚熊熊燃烧的火焰曾一度熄灭。<BR>
<BR>
因此，在第九个哀悼日，许多奴隶与敌人都被献祭了，并且按照哈宁的公式的指示混合出传递之杯：<BR>
<BR>
  2份叛徒之血<BR>
  1份迪德拉之心<BR>
  1份混合了苦绿花瓣、虚无盐、绿色地衣和骨粉的混合物<BR>
  1份月亮糖<BR>
  5瓶弗林<BR>
<BR>
在大型的黑檀器皿中混合了血液、心脏、月亮糖，点燃叛徒之骨来提供热量，将蒸汽冷凝到一个大型的黑檀烧瓶中。如果是热饮，通过劣魔的皮肤过滤其内容物，并在大型烧杯中与弗林混合，用玻璃棒缓慢搅拌；如果是冷饮，在烧杯中加入高纯度的天际冰块并剧烈摇晃，通过曙暮翼魔的翅膜进行过滤，装在嵌有宝石的高脚杯中。<BR>
<BR>
这次的计划被认为是一个巨大的成功。这种饮料杀死了很多人，因此，莫尔德林・哈宁在下面的世界就有了很多的同伴。<BR>
<BR>
"""
